org.livingdoc.api.conversion

Interface TypeConverter<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCollectionConverter, AbstractNumberConverter, AbstractTemporalConverter, BigDecimalConverter, BigIntegerConverter, BooleanConverter, ByteConverter, CharacterConverter, ColorConverter, DoubleConverter, FloatConverter, IntegerConverter, JSONConverter, ListConverter, LocalDateConverter, LocalDateTimeConverter, LocalTimeConverter, LongConverter, MapConverter, OffsetDateTimeConverter, SetConverter, ShortConverter, StringConverter, ZonedDateTimeConverter

    public TypeConverter<T>

    Classes implementing this interface are used by LivingDoc to convert a single String value into the defined target type. The converted value is used by LivingDoc as a parameter to invoke a methods or when assigning a new value to a field.

    The location where a interface TypeConverter is used is declared with the annotationclass Converter annotation. Some interface TypeConverter implementation can be configured by annotating the target of the annotationclass Converter annotation with additional annotations like annotationclass Format.

    See Also:
    String, interface TypeConverter, annotationclass Converter, interface TypeConverter, annotationclass Converter, annotationclass Format, annotationclass Converter, annotationclass Format

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        T convert(java.lang.String value,
          java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element,
          java.lang.Class<?> documentClass)

        Converts the given String value into an instance of this interface TypeConverter's target type.

        The AnnotatedElement is the element who's value should be converted (method or field) or null. It can be used to access additional configuration annotations like annotationclass Format.

        The only exception this method is allowed to throw is a exception ConversionException. If any other runtime exception is thrown during the conversion it has to be either packaged as a exception ConversionException or LivingDoc might exhibit undefined behavior.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert
        element - the element being converted - might be null!
        documentClass - the documentClass
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@3503fc59: the converted target instance
        Throws:
        ConversionException - in case the conversion failed
        See Also:
        String, interface TypeConverter, AnnotatedElement, annotationclass Format, exception ConversionException, exception ConversionException

      • canConvertTo

        boolean canConvertTo(java.lang.Class<?> targetType)

        Checks whether this interface TypeConverter can convert strings to the given type.

        Parameters:
        targetType - the type to convert to
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@69b3fb35: true if the converter can convert to the given type
        See Also:
        interface TypeConverter
